intro: Oldenlandia laxiflora, commonly known as the slenderleaf spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, white or pale blue flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and often covered with fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges.
